page.title: 07 WYNYARD HALL
page.content: THERE HAS BEEN A BUILDING ON THE SITE OF WYNYARD HALL SINCE JUST AFTER THE NORMAN CONQUEST. WYNYARD MEANS "ENCLOSED MEADOW." THIS IS AN ANGLO-SAXON WORD. WYNYARD HALL WAS BUILT ABOUT 1415 BY THOMAS DE LANGTON. THE MOST IMPORTANT DOCUMENT FOUND IS DATED 31st JANUARY,1415 IN WHICH THOMAS DE LANGTON EMPLOYED A BUILDING-CONTRACTOR TO BUILD A CROSS-CHAMBER ONTO THE MANOR HOUSE. THE MANOR HAD THEN ABOUT 263 ACRES OF LAND. TODAY LORD LONDODERRY HAS 1600 ACRES. IN THE EARLY 1800'S IT HAD A CLASSICAL REVIVAL. LOUIS QUARZOTE 3rd MARSQUE OF LONDERRY LIVED THERE AND KEPT THE TITLE UNTIL HE DIED 2 YEARS LATER IN 1863. DURING THE LIFE OF QUARZOTE AN ANCIENT CEMETRY WAS DISCOVERED BY THE ENTANCE GATES,AND WAS CERTAINLY
